verbose_text: Correspondingly, on the first day, the patient visited the clinic after discharge, her potassium level was lower at 3.4 mEq/L, and her magnesium was 1.7 mg/dL with TTKG : 5.6 (inappropriate loss of potassium into urine); after increasing the calcitriol dose to 2 mug with magnesium oxide, her potassium level was at 3.9 mEq/L, and her magnesium was 2.2 mg/dl with TTKG : 8.8 (normal excretion of potassium gradients).
